definition: 1) In a circle around; all round; on avery side of; on the outside of. 2) Near; not far from; regarding approximity time, size, quantity.
1) Second-person singular simple present tense of be. 2) first person plural simple present tense of be.
Of great size, large.
To know how to; to be able to.
Hill, rolling grassland.
Preceding all others of a series or kind; the ordinal of one; earliest.
An object of hatred.
Supposing that, assuming that, in the circumstances that; used to introduce a condition or choice.
Factually fair; right, correct; proper.
The act of showing support for, or approval of, something posted on the Internet by marking it with a vote.
To pay attention to a sound or speech.
To behave, to act.
A collective mass of people.
Comparative form of many: in greater number.
Physically close.
Alone in a category.
Used as a plural of person; a body of human beings considered generally or collectively; a group of two or more persons.
Used to form the future tense of the subjunctive mood, usually in the first person.
Not large or big; insignificant; few in numbers or size.
Soon afterward.
A function; a purpose for which something may be employed.
To a great extent or degree; extremely; exceedingly.
All females collectively; womankind.
